title: The Forgotten Affairs of Youth
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: The odds are, of course, that she would have known your mother as there were only – what? – thirty women living in Masson Hall. Everyone would  have known  everyone  else, at least by sight.'

title: The Forgotten Affairs of Youth
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: The judge did not press for more information. 'I told you that Clara and I were in Masson Hall together, didn't I?'

title: The Forgotten Affairs of Youth
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Most of us think about that, I believe. But to get back to Clara: we were both at Masson Hall for our first year

title: The Forgotten Affairs of Youth
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: See, here she is. She lived in Masson Hall at the same time as your mother.'

title: The Forgotten Affairs of Youth
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: It just shows who was there at the time, and that would have been public knowledge. The entrance of Masson Hall would have had a list of residents displayed.' She paused.
